tool.name: IDMapper
tool.description: Assigns protein/peptide identifications to features or consensus features
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir id && cp '$id' 'id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.ext)' && mkdir in && cp '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $spectra._in: mkdir spectra.in && cp '$spectra._in' 'spectra.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $spectra._in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($spectra._in.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -id 'id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.ext)' -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${in.ext}' #if $spectra._in: -spectra:in 'spectra.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $spectra._in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($spectra._in.ext)' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${in.ext}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: RT tolerance (in seconds) for the matching of peptide identifications and (consensus) features
param.help: Tolerance is understood as 'plus or minus x', so the matching range increases by twice the given value

param.label: m/z tolerance (in ppm or Da) for the matching of peptide identifications and (consensus) features
param.help: Tolerance is understood as 'plus or minus x', so the matching range increases by twice the given value

param.label: Source of m/z values for peptide identifications
param.help: If 'precursor', the precursor-m/z from the idXML is used. If 'peptide',. masses are computed from the sequences of peptide hits; in this case, an identification matches if any of its hits matches.. ('peptide' should be used together with 'feature:use_centroid_mz' to avoid false-positive matches.)

param.name: use_centroid_rt
param.label: Use the RT coordinates of the feature centroids for matching, instead of the RT ranges of the features/mass traces

param.name: use_centroid_mz
param.label: Use the m/z coordinates of the feature centroids for matching, instead of the m/z ranges of the features/mass traces
param.help: (If you choose 'peptide' as 'mz_reference', you should usually set this flag to avoid false-positive matches.)

param.name: use_subelements
param.label: Match using RT and m/z of sub-features instead of consensus RT and m/z
param.help: A consensus feature matches if any of its sub-features matches

param.name: annotate_ids_with_subelements
param.label: Store the map index of the sub-feature in the peptide ID

param.name: _in
param.label: MS run used to annotated unidentified spectra to features or consensus features
For feature/consensus maps: Assign an ID independently of whether its charge state matches that of the (consensus) feature
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Assigns protein/peptide identifications to features or consensus features.
For more information, visit https://openms.de/doxygen/release/3.1.0/html/TOPP_IDMapper.html
